journal_entry: Work in shop wrote a letter to N H Higgins Ellsworth one to Jordan & Blake
Work in shop wrote a letter to N H Higgins Ellsworth one to Jordan & Blake
About home wrote a letter to Amery Otis Ellsworth. Regs one to G H Loomes Ins. Agt. Portsmouth
Wrote a letter to Jos. Bunker one to Hale âŒ˜Emery went up stream cutting wood
Work in shop wrote a letter to Joseph Bunker
Breakfast with H D Ciombs dinner with Albert Joy wrote letter to CC Burrill came home went to Lodge of Good Templars
Breakfast at Wm. Joys dinner at Same Woods wrote letter to CC Burrill came home
Breakfast at Wm. Joys dinner at Same Woods wrote letter to CC Burrill came home
Went to W. Gouldsboro wrote letter to Hale & Emery took dinner with John Shaw tea with Evett Young lodging with the same
Breakfast with Hannah G dinner wtih Dr. Johnson wrote letter to CC burrill supper and Lodging with Hannah Goodwin
rainy build Coal bin wrote letter to Hale & Emery Ellworth Me.
Furrowed over head and studied of the sorms wrote letter to C C Burrill dinner as usual. went to Political lecture gone one hour and 15 min.
Wrote letter to H. M. Soule. one to mary Moore. one to Capt. Thomas Smallidge
Wrote letter to Byron Welsh
Gathered turnips and beets wrote letter to Hale and Emery
Wrote letter to Jordan & Blake and Perly & Russel went to work on Damons S House dinner & supper at Cila Hommonds Lodging John Shaw
Laid in Bass Harbor wrote letter to my wife
Fair weather the wind West wrote a letter to C. C. Burrill. Geo. N. Loomis. Went on board Schr A. G. Brooks to see about putting a house on. Wrote letters to Geo. N. Loomis. C. C. Burrill
The wind Eastward in morning clear worked around to the southward wrote letter to Perley. and Russell. mended furniture in forenoon. in afternoon write will for A.J. Gerrish
Calm and very moderate wrote letter to G. Hodgkins Lamoine work on window frames in shop for Geo. Sargent went to Lodge of good Templars Installed officers
The wind S.E snow by spells work in shop repairing boat for the schr Virgin begun to timber her out wrote letter to C. Stevens
The wind E.N.E  started for town meeting snowed hard and gave it up put lock on C. Stevens store wrote letter to Reg. of Deeds
The wind East snow and rain in the afternoon work on board A. G Brooks Wrote letter to Geo Tracy G. W. Butter and Town Clerk
The wind N.Easternly snow and rain moderately went on Iron Bound work for Galen Smith repairing boats dinner and supper at his house came home recd $3.50 wrote letter to G. W. Butter
The wind N.Easternly snow and rain moderately went on Iron Bound work for Galen Smith repairing boats dinner and supper at his house came home recd $3.50 wrote letter to G. W. Butter
The wind N.Easternly snow and rain moderately went on Iron Bound work for Galen Smith repairing boats dinner and supper at his house came home recd $3.50 wrote letter to G. W. Butter
The wind N.W by W. pointed and headed bolts for the boat putting rail on boat wrote letter to Henry Geyer
The wind around compass wrote letter to Henry Geyer James H. Gregory worked in forenoon. on A. G. Brooks mains oil in afternoon roping Jib topsail for my self
The wind South worked one half the forenoon on Highway commenced raining stoped work wrote letter to T. Smallidge Boston
The wind Southerly wrote a letter to Augustus Gerrish Eastport had the parlor painted
The wind Southerly worked one half day building Galley on A. G. Brooks wrote letter to Thomas Bunker, Recd one from Augustus Gerrish.
The wind southerly started in the Schr Banner for Calais got to Mark Island thick fog dinner on board went back home wrote letter Benj Kittridge East Eden
The wind southerly started in the Schr Banner for Calais got to Mark Island thick fog dinner on board went back home wrote letter Benj Kittridge East Eden
The wind southerly started in the Schr Banner for Calais got to Mark Island thick fog dinner on board went back home wrote letter Benj Kittridge East Eden
The wind southerly took the boat ashore to stop a leak and hauled of wrote letter to J. F. Kingsley
The wind N.West and fine weather wrote wrote letters to C. C. Burrill and G. L. Hodgkins worked in garden. went to Lodge of G. Templars
The wind Northerly strong breeze. went to Crabtrees neck and back in boat. wrote letter to E. Kingsley answered by Kellly Kingsley
The wind South foggy went in Jones Cove got of two scow loads of wood wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge
The wind South foggy went in Jones Cove got of two scow loads of wood wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge

The wind very moderate from East to South wrote letters to my wife and Capt. S. L.Tracy. Sailed for Brigadeer's Island after a load of wood for Cobb Lime CO  got abrest Camden at sunset. anchored at Lincolnville at Midnight.

The wind very moderate from East to South wrote letters to my wife and Capt. S. L.Tracy. Sailed for Brigadeer's Island after a load of wood for Cobb Lime CO  got abrest Camden at sunset. anchored at Lincolnville at Midnight.
The wind North West wrote letter to Capt G. L. Hodgkins went to West Gouldsboro to Settle with S. L. Tracy for load of wood
The wind North West wrote letter to Capt G. L. Hodgkins went to West Gouldsboro to Settle with S. L. Tracy for load of wood
The wind North West wrote letter to Capt G. L. Hodgkins went to West Gouldsboro to Settle with S. L. Tracy for load of wood
The wind Northerly wrote letter Henry Geyer and Hannah Goodwin
The wind South very fresh breeze and rough could not load wrote letter to Post master West Tremont S. D. Parsons Bangor
The wind N.N.W. could not load recd letter from Perley and Russell wrote letters to Chas Eaton Greens Landing and Benj. Kittridge
The wind SSE. rainy and blow wrote letters to A.N. Willey and. Geo. N. Loomis hung grindstone
The wind Easterly and snowed took dinner on board the A. G. Brooks. wrote letter to Mrs F. R. Bunker and Benj. Kittridge
The wind Westerly layed into Bucksport for temporary repairs write letters home and Galen Smith
The wind Easterly and moderate. layed to an anchor in Portland wrote letters home to Benj. Kittridge Mrs. L. Hammond and C. Stevens
The wind very moderate from N.W. to S.W. layed in Portland wrote letter to H. Ross of Bangor. sent papers home by mail. Ellsworth American and New Sensation
The wind from West to West South West got underway in Portsmouth in morning anchored in Portland at 2 PM. wrote letter home snowed in afternoon
The wind from West to West South West got underway in Portsmouth in morning anchored in Portland at 2 PM. wrote letter home snowed in afternoon
The wind North East wrote letter to Ellsworth American. turned Indian clubs for Mr Howard Tacher went to Lodge of Good Templars. snowed in evening
The wind West Wrote letters to D. T. Tyler and Thomas Bunker
The wind southerly made damper for stove pipe wrote letter to Proctor Smallidge
The wind N.E. very cold and snowy went up the stream cutting wood wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge
The wind Easterly big snow storm wrote letter to Evans Young went to Navigation School
The wind North West cold wrote letter to Arno Wiswell Esq.
The wind Northerly moderate and warm wrote letters to Dr Lewis Dr Johnson Mr. Lucy Martin ans Wm. Joy went to Navigation School
The wind Southerly and warm wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge surveyed wood for Flora Gerrish worked in shop apart of the day on boat
The wind Southerly wrote letter to Josiah Smallidge
The wind very moderate to the S.S.E. Wrote letter to Saml. Libby and work on board vessel
Calm in morning with snow. The wind South West in afternoon wrote letter to L. D. Parsons Bangor William and Dean Rockland for freight also William Stevens Machias.
The wind Southerly got underway at daylight got to Bangor at 2 P.M. chattered to go to Lynn with slabs wrote letter home
The wind South East and foggy in forenoon westerly and clear at night came out of Portland at 6pm calm all night wrote letter home
The wind W.N.W. hauled into the wharf to to fix the vessel. Wrote letter to Charles Burrill.
The wind South West towed up river in morning wrote letter home.
The wind N. N. E. worked on vessel in forenoon made mast thot in afternoon wrote letter to Hancock Company Pub Co enclosed $1.60
The wind Northerly hunted all day for freight took up at night to go to Boston wrote letter to James Staples Lubec for a freight
The wind Northerly hunted all day for freight took up at night to go to Boston wrote letter to James Staples Lubec for a freight
The wind N. W. very moderate and pleasant wrote letter home and one to Capt. Thomas Bunker
The wind Northerly got in home at 2 AM came out at one PM went through Western wayat sunset and anchored in outer Bass Harbor at 12 oclock at night perfectly calm wrote letter toBangor
The wind Northerly got in home at 2 AM came out at one PM went through Western wayat sunset and anchored in outer Bass Harbor at 12 oclock at night perfectly calm wrote letter toBangor
The wind Northerly got in home at 2 AM came out at one PM went through Western wayat sunset and anchored in outer Bass Harbor at 12 oclock at night perfectly calm wrote letter toBangor
The wind West by South abrest of Baker's Island at day light. got into Boston at 4 pm. wrote letter home
The wind West by South abrest of Baker's Island at day light. got into Boston at 4 pm. wrote letter home
The wind Northerly went to West Gouldsboro and East sullivan after a load of wood and to settle with James Doyle for a load carried to Boston. wrote letter to E. H. Wallace
The wind Northerly went to West Gouldsboro and East sullivan after a load of wood and to settle with James Doyle for a load carried to Boston. wrote letter to E. H. Wallace
The wind Northerly went to West Gouldsboro and East sullivan after a load of wood and to settle with James Doyle for a load carried to Boston. wrote letter to E. H. Wallace
The wind South West and foggy made decoys for Geo Gerrish and dug potatoes wrote letter to Thomas Bunker.

The wind Southerly and foggy bought a stick of Win Rand to make a flying jib boom in forenoon and went to work making it with J. f. Kingsley in afternoon wrote letters to Robt Miles and Nickerson and Rideout
Very moderate all day with the wind Westerly worked on vessel wrote letter to the Hancock Co Pub Co.
The wind West heavy blow hauled into David Ames wharf and sold deckload and discharged it. wrote letter home
The wind North and overcast. got under way in morning for home arrived at 9 am. got water and provision on board and got ready to go to Rockland wrote letter to Thomas Bunker
The wind North and overcast. got under way in morning for home arrived at 9 am. got water and provision on board and got ready to go to Rockland wrote letter to Thomas Bunker
The wind North East wrote letter to the Secretary of Narraguagus Lodge got the Sea Flower underway and went to South West Harbor and landed freight hauled away from wharf at dark.
The wind North East wrote letter to the Secretary of Narraguagus Lodge got the Sea Flower underway and went to South West Harbor and landed freight hauled away from wharf at dark.
The wind North East wrote letter to the Secretary of Narraguagus Lodge got the Sea Flower underway and went to South West Harbor and landed freight hauled away from wharf at dark.
The wind North East very moderate all day with snow wrote letters to Hancock Co Pub Co and Thomas Bunker work in shop.

The wind N. East in morning snowing S.S.E. in afternoon settled account with Capt Thomas Hammond Schr Amulet. wrote letters to Sec of Continental Life Ins Co. Hartford David Tyler Deer Isle. and J. A. Pilsbury of Bucksport W. H. Pilsbury
The wind Westerly moderate wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge work in shop
The wind North West work in shop recd letter from Benj. Kittridge wrote letter to W. B. McCrate.
The wind westerly moderate wrote letters to Benj Kittridge and Aiken and Co Sent Signals bills to Aiken and Co. Ellsworth
The wind Westerly work in shop wrote letter to H. D. Coombs and recd letter from H. D. Coombs
The wind Northerly wrote letters to Ellsworth American Benj. Kittridge and sent Papers of Amulets and Signal to Benj Kittridge also a statement of the Amulets account for the year ending 1874
The wind very moderate South West and very warm snow melts fast.  wrote letter to Thomas Bunker recd one from Benj. Kittridge. work in shop
The wind South Easterly and rainy work in shop. Finished the Black Warior's wheel wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge.
The wind Easterly and pleasant. wrote letter to Caroline Blaisdell. work in shop
Calm in morning wrote letter to Thomas Bunker work in the fore noon on the Harps cabbin In the afternoon the wind South East painted inside of dora in shop
The wind Easterly and misty. took the new dora out the shop and took her to the shore Wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge
The wind N. N. East wrote letters to Secreraty of Treasury in the afternoon the wind out Southerly worked on the Harp recd letter from Benj. Kittridge
The wind Westerly in forenoon work on Henriettas cabbin and gangway Southerly wind in afternoon wrote letter to C. C. Burrill
The wind Southerly work for J. M. Sargent on Schr Henrietta wrote letter to Benj. Kittidge.
The wind North East rainy all day untill about sunset. the wind hauling to the North. wrote letters to Thomas Bunker Register of Probate Caroline Blaisdell and Saml. Libby

calm in morning wrote letter to Penobscot Ins Co at 9 AM moderate South West Wind left home for Calais kept of by schoodic at 2 PM passed Red Head at dark and Little River light at 12 midnight the wind hauled to the North went into Little River

calm in morning wrote letter to Penobscot Ins Co at 9 AM moderate South West Wind left home for Calais kept of by schoodic at 2 PM passed Red Head at dark and Little River light at 12 midnight the wind hauled to the North went into Little River

The wind N. E. to South. laid at anchor below the Ledge untill 2 oclock very large cakes comming down got underway at 2 PM. sailed through the drift ice and went up to the wharf in Calais wrote letter home
The wind westerly and pleasant set up rigging and mending sails towed into the wharf in Charlestown to discharge coal wrote letter home recd one from home
The wind North W. work on vessel in forenoon and towed to Calais in afternoon. on bent the old foresail and got ready to commence loading. wrote letter home
The wind Southerly and foggy work in garden. wrote letters to James Chillcot and Secretary of Treasury D.C.
The wind Southerly and foggy Work in Garden. wrote letters to Josiah Smallidge and Eunice Kingsley
The wind Southerly and foggy. wrote letters to Mary Am. Rosebrook work in shop
The wind Northerly fine breeze. work for J. F. Kingsley haying all day wrote letter to C Stevens Esqr and Hancock Co pub Co.
The wind S.W. towed in to the dock in Brooklyn wrote letter home.
The wind Easterly and very warm wrote letter home went up town & bought a lot of Carpenters tools
The wind West and cold Went to Plymouth Church Preaching by H.W. Beecker wrote letters home and J.F. Kingsley & A Smallidge
The wind Westerly Stevedores Took out ballast wrote letter to Freeman Tracy
The wind Easterly wrote letter to J.H.S. and Galen Smith. Went to Hospital and got fingers done up
Wrote letter home from the Hospital
The wind Easterly fresh breeze anchored in Baracoa at 8 AM moored stern. wrote letter home
The wind variable wrote letter home
The wind Southerly wrote letter home
The wind Westerly and pleasant Case of Mr. Biryen O.S. Mr. verdict in favor of defendent. Wiswell & Wiswell for plaintiff & Hale & Emery for defendent. Wrote letter home
The wind North North East. moderate snow storm call day First Snow for the Season wrote letter home.
The wind Northerly wrote letter to E.V. Lynam worked apart of the forenoon for C. J.Guflill
The wind moderate N.E. in forenoon Calm in afternoon Worked one half day on G.W. Tracy's out buildings wrote letter to Wiswell& Wiswell
The wind Westerly work in the afternoon for G.W. Tracy. wrote letter to Josiah Smallidge. and Hancock Citizen
The wind moderate all day Southerly wrote letter to Charles Peter Bangor. work in shop making Closet for W.M Pendleton
The wind North West wrote letter to Capt Thomas Bunker work in shop mending furniture met for rehearsal at G. W. Tracys store.
The wind Southerly work in forenoon of the Hall. In the afternoon work at home put shoe on boats put. Wrote letter to N.H.Higgins Jr.
The wind Easterly snowy in forenoon wrote letter to F Haines Biddeford. Maine Went to the Hall and got My costume and Exhibition furniture
The wind Easterly and Rainy. wrote letters to Capt Thomas Bunker and J.T. Wallace Jr. Went to Prospect Harbor and took up note of $100. of H.D. Coombs
The wind North East and heavy rain all day. work about the house. Wrote letter to E.C.Smith Boston & E. V. Lynman Long Pong
The wind North East and snowy. all day wrote letter to Mijsrs Maymard Gough &Co. work all day in house painting furniture Received letter from Curtis Stevens
The wind North West. wrote letter to C.C. Burril work in the house cleaning up
The wind Northerly and clear. took the Gtage to West Gouldsboro and came home Wrote letter to C.C. Burril Ellsworth
The wind N.N.West. wrote letter to J. A Milliken Cherryfield. Work hauling stone around the house. reed letters from Thomas Bunker Cranberry Isles. And C C Burril at Ellsworth.
The wind Northerly wrote letters to Stephen Southard Thomas Bunker & Mejsrs S Le Muney &Co. went to Ellsworth with L. G. Cranes horse after money got $500.
The wind Southerly fresh breeze. wrote letter to Curtis Stevens Mejsrs M Gallent. and H. D. Coombs. work about home.

The wind Northerly and moderate snowy all the fore noon Thermometer at 25Â° above zero work apart of the day for J D Harrington Wrote letters to Thomas Bunker & CC Burrill + postal card to F. Haines Biddeford
The wind North West The Thermometer from 0 to 6 above. Wrote letter to C C Burrill Finished planning & painting floor for G. W. Tracy.
The wind Southerly moderate rain storm all day Thermometer 38 degrees above zero Wrote letter to S. L. Tracy made cupboard for J D Harrington

Calm all day, The Thermometer 2 degrees above in the morning Wrote letter to the Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co of Bangor. Work in the house making liba Recd letter from Capt E. V. Lynam. Long pond. Went to a religious meeting in the Evening.

The wind Northerly + moderate Thermometer from 28 degrees to 35 above zero. Wrote letter to H.D. Coombs Augusta for a commission as Justice of the Peace. Helped J.K. Kingsley shingle the roof of his ice house Recd letter from Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co.
Calm all day Thermometer at 44 degrees above zero. Wrote letter to C C Burrill Cut wood at the door Went to Dick Martz. Exhibition in evening

The wind West Thermometer at 20 degrees above zero. Wrote letters to American Office Ellsworth and Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co Went on sail in yatcht Water Lily Capt R Pendeleton Rect letter from C.C. Burrill
The wind North West Thermometer at 20 above zero Wrote letters to A J Baker M.D. Postal Cards to N.H. Higgins and Galen H Smith.

The wind North West. Thermometer 34 degrees above zero. Registered letter to Treasurer of State of Maine for a commission as justice of the Peace. wrote letter to R. Fickett + Son Mulbridge Recd letter from H.D. Coombs Postal card from Lizzie May

The wind Southerly Thermometer 32 above Work all day for Wm Handy splicing Sea Pigeons mainmast Wrote letters to Myses Maynard Gough & Co & R Fickett + Sons. Recd commission from the State as justice of the peace.
The wind Moderate N.W. Thermometer 48 degrees above 0  Wrote letter to Messes Maynard Gough + Co. Worked a part of the day in J.F. Kingsleys shop on a boat building for my self.

Wrote letter to E.W. Cleaves The wind North West Thermometer 18 above Went to West Gouldsboro. and took the stage & Went to Ellsworth after money got $100 of C C Burrill Was qualified as justice of the peace

Wrote letter to E.W. Cleaves The wind North West Thermometer 18 above Went to West Gouldsboro. and took the stage & Went to Ellsworth after money got $100 of C C Burrill Was qualified as justice of the peace

The wind West. Thermometer 36Â° degrees attended the funeral of Mrs. Lucinda Hammond Wrote letter to Freeland Rosebrook Recd letter from Chas Shaw Recd letter heads & envelopes printed from the American Office
The wind Easterly Thermometer 36Â° Wrote letters to Myses M Gallant &Co Henry Benson Chas Shaw & Geo Westcott Eldridge & Perry Commenced planking boat for my self
The wind N.N. East. and Snowy all day. Thermometer 33 above wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith

The wind Northerly and overcast Thermometer 34Â° above Wrote letter to Myses. R Fickett + Sons. Work all day on Pile driver for Gerrish and Tracy. Recd letter from Eldridge & Perry. Alice Tracy died about midnight
The wind North East. and rainy and rainy all day. Thermometer 38Â° Finished Pile driver for Gerrish Tracy &Co. Wrote letter to Bertha Smallidge
The wind N.N.East. Thermometer 36Â° Wrote letters to Reg of deeds Mysrs Cobb Wight & Norton Work about home.
The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 44Â° Wrote letters to Genl Agt Portland Bangor & Machias Steamboat Co. and Capt. David Robinson Put gunwails on boat.
The wind North East. Thermometer 54Â° Wrote letters to Mrs Proctor Smallidge, S.C. Forsaith, &Co, Thomas Bunker & E.A. Baker Recd Hotel Register from Mysrs Maynard &Co.
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 48 Wrote letters to Capt H.C. Guptill Calais work a little while on boat.
The wind South East. and rainy in morning Thermometer 50 degrees. Wrote letters to S.C. Muney &Co. Worked on boat apart of the afternoon. Recd letter from S.C. Forsaith Red Speech from Han E Hale
The wind North East and heavy rain all day. Thermomter 49Â° wrote letter to Mrs. Martin Pendleton at Lynn Recd letter from Geo Bagley work about the house. C.J. Guptill made each as school agt.
The wind South West and clear. Thermometer 54Â° Cut wood at the door wrote letter to G.W. Bagley
The wind Easterly and rainy Thermometer 52Â° wrote letter to Mysrs Eldridge & Perry. Sold Massiah Southards horse to Mr W.F. Vose.

The wind South West Pleasant Thermometer 53 Wrote letter to J.D. Femeld and Stephen Southard. Went to Bar Harbor in my boat & back. Recd letters from S.R. Niles advertising agents. Boston & Abraham French & Co. Dealers in Crocking & glass ware.

The wind South West Pleasant Thermometer 53 Wrote letter to J.D. Femeld and Stephen Southard. Went to Bar Harbor in my boat & back. Recd letters from S.R. Niles advertising agents. Boston & Abraham French & Co. Dealers in Crocking & glass ware.

The wind South West Pleasant Thermometer 53 Wrote letter to J.D. Femeld and Stephen Southard. Went to Bar Harbor in my boat & back. Recd letters from S.R. Niles advertising agents. Boston & Abraham French & Co. Dealers in Crocking & glass ware.
The wind N.N.West Thermometer 41Â° degrees Wrote letters to Eldridge &  Perry also Rev Mr. Tripp of Surry

South East wind overcast Thermometer. Wrote letters to American Office Chas Burrill (of Ellsworth) and F.W. Webber (Cambridgeport) Daily Courier (Lowell)  Mrs. Geddy. Commenced laying platform around house
The wind S.S. East Thermometer 49Â°  Wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith E.A. Baker Mrs. J.D. Fernald
The wind North East, in morning fresh breeze at 10 am wind moderate Thermometer 54Â° Went to Bar Harbor With R Pendleton after Mary Smallidge wrote letters to Mrs J.D. Fernald
The wind North East, in morning fresh breeze at 10 am wind moderate Thermometer 54Â° Went to Bar Harbor With R Pendleton after Mary Smallidge wrote letters to Mrs J.D. Fernald
The wind Southerly & foggy Wrote letter to American Office. and came home in forenoon Thermometer 55 degrees.
The wind from N.W. to S.W. and the Thermometer 62 Wrote letter to F.W. Webber. Cambridgeport Recd letter from Boston Home Journal. Hauled wood from the wharf for T. H. Smallidge work around the House
The wind Southerly & Foggy Thermometer 55Â° Had Parlor papered by Frank Summer and worked around the House Wrote letter to Eldridge & Perry. and Recd letter from Mrs J.D. Fernald
The wind baffling and moderate all day. Thermometer 52 degrees Wrote letter to American Office work all day on house. on water closet.
The wind North East and rainy all day Thermometer 50 degrees Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill laid carpet in chamber Went Birch Harbor at night to Carry John McFarland of Lamoine and brought him back
The wind North East and rainy all day Thermometer 50 degrees Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill laid carpet in chamber Went Birch Harbor at night to Carry John McFarland of Lamoine and brought him back
The wind North East and rainy all day Thermometer 50 degrees Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill laid carpet in chamber Went Birch Harbor at night to Carry John McFarland of Lamoine and brought him back
The wind Southerly and Foggy. Thermometer 53Â° made sign board for R Rand to paint Eureka House Recd letters from Boston Transcript Office Wrote letters to Frank Woodard
The wind Southerly & foggy Thermometer 58Â° Went to Sullivan to Mr Pettengills to see Abbie Crabtree wrote letter to Eldridge & Perry. Went to prospect at night. Recd letter from Emma M. Spurling
The wind Southerly Thermometer 69 degrees work all day with horse grading in front of the house Wrote letter to E.A. Baker
The wind Southerly and foggy in morning at night the wind W. Thermometer 60 degrees. Painted Hall floor and work around the house. Wrote letter to Emma Spurling.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 84Â° at 5 p.m. Wrote letter to G.W. Bagley went to Prospect in afternoon. worked apart of the day making flying boom for the Schr Black Warrior
The wind South West Thermometer 85 degrees high in the shade wrote letters to G.W. Bagley and Frank Woodard
The wind Southerly Thermometer 76Â° Wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith & Co. Walter Wood S.L. Dennison owners of Str Magnet Genl Agt of Sto Chas Houghton A.J.Chapman Esq.

The wind Northerly Thermometer 52 Wrote letter to owners of Steamer Magnet Drove stage from Winter Harbor to W. Gouldsboro Recd letters from S.C. Forsaith & Co. & A White of Hingham Hired Mrs J.D. Fernald for cook for the summer

The wind Northerly Thermometer 52 Wrote letter to owners of Steamer Magnet Drove stage from Winter Harbor to W. Gouldsboro Recd letters from S.C. Forsaith & Co. & A White of Hingham Hired Mrs J.D. Fernald for cook for the summer
The wind Southerly Thermometer 62 degrees Wrote letter to A White of Hingham work building steps to plat form and clearing up door yard.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 68 degrees Wrote letter to Elias Hale & CC Vedall. Recd Letter from Elias J Hale

The wind S.S. East in forenoon and very heavy rain In the afternoon cleared up Thermometer 70Â° degrees wrote letters to Geo S Peters and A White of Hingham work apart of the day on Express wagon for my self turning hub &e
The wind Southerly Thermometer wrote letters to G.S. Peters M Gallery &Co & Eldridge & Perry. Recd letter from Mary Smallidge
The wind Southerly Thermometer 58 degrees Wrote letter to Mary Smallidge. finished the boat that was begun last winter Recd letter from M. Gallant &Co.
The wind South East Thermometer 58 1/2 degrees Wrote letter to Mr Vose Recieved Mrs Lizzie Amisden the first summer boarder for the season
The wind West North West in forenoon & clear Thermometer 68 Went to Prospect Harbor with horse work about home most the day Wrote letter to Louis Oshurn & Co.
The wind West North West in forenoon & clear Thermometer 68 Went to Prospect Harbor with horse work about home most the day Wrote letter to Louis Oshurn & Co.
The wind Northerly then Easterly and pleasant Thermometer 65 work abt home. Wrote letter home Mr. Wm B Viall of Bethel V.T.
The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 64Â° Work all day for Mr Wm Guptill on house Wrote letter to Messrs J.W. Davis & son.
The wind Easterly foggy and rainy all day Thermometer 60Â° Work all day for Wm Guptill on his house Recd letter from Wm B Viall Bethel  V.T. Wrote letter to Messrs J.W. Davis & son
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 65Â° Went to West Gouldsboro and back. wrote letter to Mary Smallidge Mt Desert
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 65Â° Went to West Gouldsboro and back. wrote letter to Mary Smallidge Mt Desert
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 65Â° Went to West Gouldsboro and back. wrote letter to Mary Smallidge Mt Desert
The wind Southerly Thermometer 61 degrees Wrote letter to American Office. Work all day for Wm Guptill.
The wind Southerly and thick with fog all day Thermometer 60 work about home. Wrote letter to Saml Libby
The wind Westerly Thermometer 60 degrees Wrote letter to Messrs SC Muney & Co.
The wind South very fresh breeze and foggy Thermometer 59 degrees Wrote letters to NH Higgins & Wm B Viall Went to a Religious meeting in the evening very heavy rain at 9 pm
The wind Westerly overcast and fresh breeze Thermometer 43Â° wrote letter to Ida Hodgkins Lamoine
The wind Southerly Thermometer 55 work for Wm Guptill on the inside of his house wrote letter to SC Muney & Co.
The wind North East and overcast Thermometer 47. Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail wrote letter to A.J. Blethen Esqr Portland Attorney at law. Recd letter from Mr AJ Blethen of Portland.
The wind North East and overcast Thermometer 47. Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail wrote letter to A.J. Blethen Esqr Portland Attorney at law. Recd letter from Mr AJ Blethen of Portland.
The wind North West work one fourth day for Wm Guptill Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Thermometer 43 degrees Recd letters from Wm B Viall and A J Blethen wrote letter to AJ Blethen of Portland
The wind North West work one fourth day for Wm Guptill Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Thermometer 43 degrees Recd letters from Wm B Viall and A J Blethen wrote letter to AJ Blethen of Portland
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50 degrees Work in the forenoon for Wm Guptill and in the afternoon went to Birch Harbor to Capt L.G. Cranes Funeral Wrote letter to A.J. Blethen
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50 degrees Work in the forenoon for Wm Guptill and in the afternoon went to Birch Harbor to Capt L.G. Cranes Funeral Wrote letter to A.J. Blethen
The wind North West work 3/4 day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect Harbor Hired $40 of EW Cleaves for 14 days. Thermometer 32 wrote letter to AJ Blethen Ellsworth
The wind North West work 3/4 day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect Harbor Hired $40 of EW Cleaves for 14 days. Thermometer 32 wrote letter to AJ Blethen Ellsworth
The wind North West work 3/4 day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect Harbor Hired $40 of EW Cleaves for 14 days. Thermometer 32 wrote letter to AJ Blethen Ellsworth
The wind Southerly Thermometer 41 degrees wrote letter to Warren Smith J A Stephens & Stephen Southard
The wind North East and rainy in the afternoon Thermometer 40 work 3/4 of the day for Wm Guptill wrote letter to Bessie E Grant.
The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 35 degrees wrote letters to SM Inmans and Bessie Grant Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. very heavy blow and rain in the afternoon and evening
The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 35 degrees wrote letters to SM Inmans and Bessie Grant Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. very heavy blow and rain in the afternoon and evening

The wind Easterly fresh breeze and big rain storm Thermometer 40 wrote letter to M Gallant work one half day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect at night to Carry 40 dollars that I hired of E.W. Cleaves the fourteenth of this month. recd letter from J A Stevens

The wind Easterly fresh breeze and big rain storm Thermometer 40 wrote letter to M Gallant work one half day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect at night to Carry 40 dollars that I hired of E.W. Cleaves the fourteenth of this month. recd letter from J A Stevens
The wind S.S.E and fresh breeze Thermometer 35Â° wrote letters to Bessie E Grant Mrs Proctor Smallidge and Mary Stanley went to West Gouldsboro with mail very heavy storm at night.
The wind S.S.E and fresh breeze Thermometer 35Â° wrote letters to Bessie E Grant Mrs Proctor Smallidge and Mary Stanley went to West Gouldsboro with mail very heavy storm at night.

Calm all day with the exception of a light air westerly Thermometer 30 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. Wrote letter and reg it to Messrs M Gallant & Co. at night went in the woods and hauled out one load of wood on wheels

Calm all day with the exception of a light air westerly Thermometer 30 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. Wrote letter and reg it to Messrs M Gallant & Co. at night went in the woods and hauled out one load of wood on wheels

The wind North West Thermometer 20 degrees Wrote letter to Mrs. B.E. Grant hired John Hancock to drive the mail I staid at home and salted my pig and a quarter of beef. wrote letter to American Office
The wind moderate and varying from North to East. Thermometer 10 degrees above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. recd letter from CC Burrill Wrote letter to Mrs Bessie E Grant of Camden
The wind moderate and varying from North to East. Thermometer 10 degrees above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. recd letter from CC Burrill Wrote letter to Mrs Bessie E Grant of Camden
The wind North West the Thermometer 18 degrees above Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill Cut wood at the door.

The wind North West wrote letter to R. Cole Ellsworth some sleighing the first for the winter sleigh goes through in some places. Varnished my sleigh and tending out on the People stoping with me at the Eureka House
The wind North West Thermometer 25Â° above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B Viall at Bethel Vt. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail with sleigh.
The wind North West Thermometer 25Â° above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B Viall at Bethel Vt. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail with sleigh.
The wind North West Thermometer 25Â° above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B Viall at Bethel Vt. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail with sleigh.

A very big snow storm The wind North West Thermometer 12 degrees above Wrote letter to C. C. Burrill Started with the mail to West Gouldsboro Got as far as Wm Bunkers with the horse and could get no further with him put him in the barna nd Carried the mail on my back to West Gouldsboro

A very big snow storm The wind North West Thermometer 12 degrees above Wrote letter to C. C. Burrill Started with the mail to West Gouldsboro Got as far as Wm Bunkers with the horse and could get no further with him put him in the barna nd Carried the mail on my back to West Gouldsboro

A very big snow storm The wind North West Thermometer 12 degrees above Wrote letter to C. C. Burrill Started with the mail to West Gouldsboro Got as far as Wm Bunkers with the horse and could get no further with him put him in the barna nd Carried the mail on my back to West Gouldsboro
Calm in the morning wrote letter to Stephen Southard Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail afternoon wind westerly Thermometer 22 above Reed letter from Wm B Viall Mail Contractor Bethel Vt.
Calm in the morning wrote letter to Stephen Southard Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail afternoon wind westerly Thermometer 22 above Reed letter from Wm B Viall Mail Contractor Bethel Vt.
Calm in the morning wrote letter to Stephen Southard Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail afternoon wind westerly Thermometer 22 above Reed letter from Wm B Viall Mail Contractor Bethel Vt.
The wind North West Thermometer 10Â° above 0. wrote letter to Narraguzy Lodge Cherryfield. Went up the stream after wood but the Stream overflowed could not get in woods
The wind East North East and snowing all day Thermometer 14 degrees above zero. Mended horness apart of the day. wrote letter to Bessie E. Grant and C.C. Burrill
The wind Westerly Thermometer 20 above wrote letters to Portland Transcript Ellsworth Arrived Town Clerk. Mary Stanley E.S.Stevens of Ellsworth Hauled two loads of wood from upper damn.
The wind W.N.West and snowing a little in the morning Thermometer 24 above zero. Wrote letter to Mrs Bessie E Grant. and kept a copy.
The wind South West Thermometer 37 snow melting very fast. work all day hauling wood wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the PO Department. at Washington D.C.

The wind Southerly Thermometer 32Â° above Went in the woods in the forenoon and out a spar for the A G Brook fhing jilboans in the afternoon work for Wm Guptill Wrote letters to Wm B Viall & Mejses Sloan &Co.

The wind South East. Thermometer 39Â° above worked out half day for Wm Guptill on house. Went to West Gouldsboro to see about P.O.Business. wrote letters to Wm B Viall and Auditor of the P.O.Department Reed letters from Linda SMallidge & Wm B Viall

The wind South East. Thermometer 39Â° above worked out half day for Wm Guptill on house. Went to West Gouldsboro to see about P.O.Business. wrote letters to Wm B Viall and Auditor of the P.O.Department Reed letters from Linda SMallidge & Wm B Viall

The wind South East. Thermometer 39Â° above worked out half day for Wm Guptill on house. Went to West Gouldsboro to see about P.O.Business. wrote letters to Wm B Viall and Auditor of the P.O.Department Reed letters from Linda SMallidge & Wm B Viall
The wind Westerly Termometer 32 degree Wrote letters to F.W. Wobbur Cambridge port & Han Elias & Yuraveis whiting
The wind E S East Thermometer 20 above wrote letter to C.C. Viall Lowell & Nancy Ash Sullivan. Snowing all day. with fresh breeze. wrote letter to B. T Athon Sherriff of Mt. Desert.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 30 above wrote letter to Eias Hale and Wm. P Joy Esq. Reed letters from Mejsis Sloaan &Co. X Wamn Smithal Calais
The wind Easterly Thermometer 40Â° above wrote letter Portland & Machias Steam boat Bo & Linda Smallidge work in the afternoon for G.W. Tracy on dora Reed Postal from L L Kingsley

The wind North East Thermometer 36 degrees hauled one load of wood out the woods near Mr Dodge's alongside of the road and in the afternoon it rained hard. wrote letter to Red of deeds Postal to Mssrs Sloan &Co
The wind South West Settled the Law business between John F. Clark and Warren H Smith work all day for A J Gerrish wrote letter to Isaac Tracy. and Helen Stevens
The wind Northerly in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon. Sold 3 sets Sewing machine Casters Bought two shark in Winter Harbor Steam boat wharf wrote letter to Mrs Chester Stevens

The wind North East and snowing all day Thermometer 32 above Went to West Gouldsboro on wheels with the mail via Prospect. Wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department Real letter from Mijr Linda Smallidge

The wind North East and snowing all day Thermometer 32 above Went to West Gouldsboro on wheels with the mail via Prospect. Wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department Real letter from Mijr Linda Smallidge

The wind North East and snowing all day Thermometer 32 above Went to West Gouldsboro on wheels with the mail via Prospect. Wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department Real letter from Mijr Linda Smallidge

The wind North East and snowing all day Thermometer 32 above Went to West Gouldsboro on wheels with the mail via Prospect. Wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department Real letter from Mijr Linda Smallidge

Wrote letter to Wm B Viall. The wind North West and very pleasant with the Thermometer 42 degrees. Went to West Gouldsboro and got one doz sets of casters. from Sloan &Co. I being their agent. for Hancock County. to see t sell the celebrated six wheel swing machine Castero.

Wrote letter to Wm B Viall. The wind North West and very pleasant with the Thermometer 42 degrees. Went to West Gouldsboro and got one doz sets of casters. from Sloan &Co. I being their agent. for Hancock County. to see t sell the celebrated six wheel swing machine Castero.

Wrote letter to Wm B Viall. The wind North West and very pleasant with the Thermometer 42 degrees. Went to West Gouldsboro and got one doz sets of casters. from Sloan &Co. I being their agent. for Hancock County. to see t sell the celebrated six wheel swing machine Castero.

The wind South West and overcast. and sprinkle of rain in the forenoon Thermometer 34 degrees at 10 Am. started for Bar Harbor to sell Sewing Machine castero Wrote letter to Mejrss Sloan &Co. Cincinnati O manufacturer Sewing Machine castero wind North in evening.

The wind South West and overcast. and sprinkle of rain in the forenoon Thermometer 34 degrees at 10 Am. started for Bar Harbor to sell Sewing Machine castero Wrote letter to Mejrss Sloan &Co. Cincinnati O manufacturer Sewing Machine castero wind North in evening.

The wind South West and overcast. and sprinkle of rain in the forenoon Thermometer 34 degrees at 10 Am. started for Bar Harbor to sell Sewing Machine castero Wrote letter to Mejrss Sloan &Co. Cincinnati O manufacturer Sewing Machine castero wind North in evening.

The wind South West Thermometer 50 degrees cut wood in the forenoon at the door. Wrote letter to Portland Bangor & Machias Steam boat Co. Capt Wm Handy agrees to give my wife his homestead place for his maintenance.

The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 degrees wrote letter to Mr E.A.Baker. Made 2 vite Claim deed for Warren Smith and one for Charles E Smith reed letter from Wm B Viall and from Second assistant post Warts Gennd
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 38 foggy wrote letter Julra A. Barnard and Wm B Viall acknowledged for Curtis Stevens.
The wind South East Thermometer 37 degrees heavy rain storm all day wrote letter to A. Wisell Esq. and Gilbert L. Dennison worked most all day putting ceiling in Mr E A Bakers row boat.
The wind Easterly and foggy Thermometer 40 degrees Wrote letter to Eldridge Perry Wm B Viall of Vermont. Cut wood apart of the day at home Set all night with Capt Handy.
The wind North East Thermometer 54 and moderate rain all day work in house on Mr E. A. bakers boat putting in ceiling Wrote letter to the Boston Post.
Calm in the morning and overcast rainy all day Thermometer. 50 degrees wrote letters Eldridge & Perry T.R. Hammond at New York and two to Mrs French Rochester & Philadelphia The wind Easterly

The wind Came of in the forenoon North West and pleasant. Thermometer 57 degrees wrote letters to Boston Post Daily Traveller and Chas Mckey all of Boston. Went to Prospect and got 450 lbs hay for myself settled with Jennie Tracy

The wind Came of in the forenoon North West and pleasant. Thermometer 57 degrees wrote letters to Boston Post Daily Traveller and Chas Mckey all of Boston. Went to Prospect and got 450 lbs hay for myself settled with Jennie Tracy
The wind Southerly Thermometer 54 degrees work about home. Wrote letters to Boston Traveller & Transcript Reed several letters from advertising agts.

The wind Southerly The thermometer 55 degree Finished cutting the wood at the door filed saur and work about home wrote letters to J.W.Davis at Ellsworth and Boston Courier & Boston Transcript Reed letters from Home Journal and 5 other advertising agents.
The wind North West and The Thermometer. 78 degrees made cart body Reed Postal from Mrs. Henry Chapis from Keene. N.H. making Inquires about board Wrote letter Janette Smith.

The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees. wrote letter to Mrs Henry Chapin Keene N.H. Work on the road with horse in forenoon repairing it. Work in the afternoon for R Pendleton. Mijs Mary Gerrish died at 9 oclock in evening.
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 60 degrees wrote letter to Mrs Chester Stevens. Work all day on high way. with my horse. Iron Bound Spindle set on Guptills point.
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 60 degrees Sent two deeds to Ellsworth to be recorded. wrote letters to Walter G Maker of Boston and Wm B. Viall Vermont Signed quarterly returns of P.M.
The wind Southerly and rainy all day Thermometer 65 degrees wrote letters to Eldridge & Perry and Mrs Henry Chapin Painted my row boat.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 68 degrees Finished hoeing my potatoes and painted my boat. Wrote letter to Walter G Maker of Boston.
The wind North West in the forenoon & South West in the afternoon Thermometer 62Â° work all day haying wrote letters to Mrs Bessie E Crant and M. Gallart &Co. Reed letter from Miss Guenlief
The wind Southerly Thermometer 52Â° Went to West Gouldsbo with the Mail. Wrote letter to Mr Helen Stevens
The wind South West Thermometer 67 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro Reed letter from RH Kittredge &Co and wrote letter to R H Kittredge & Co and to A P Wiswell Esq. oath o G W Tracy as Post master.
The wind North West Thermometer in the morn at 0 in the afternoon 20 above. Wrote letter to the Bangor Commerilal Reed Card from H B Sandrs
The wind South West. Thermometer 32 degrees Wrote letter to Wm B Viall In afternoon went to Prospect with E Kingsley
Calm all day and the Thermometer 40Â° Wrote letter to Mejsrs Sherman &Co. Marshall Mich. Reed the first copy of the Bangor Communicae
The wind South East. Thermometer 40 degrees above Reed duplicate check from the P.O. Department for the Quarter ending Sept 30. Wrote letter to G H Smith Reed letter from Hugh Mc Kay Canada.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 37 degrees wrote letter to Wm B Viall of Bethel Vt. and Auditor of the Treasurer Washington
The wind South West and very fresh breeze Thermometer 28Â° Wrote letter to Helen B Stevens at Laurence.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 30Â° Wrote letter to Geo H. Brown Ellsworth for Geo Gerrish Work all day for N.A.Bickford
The wind South West Thermometer 32 degrees wrote letter to Capt Horace Handy at Portland. Cut wood at the door.
The wind North East and in the morning Thermometer at zero. In the afternoon snowy. Reed letter from Henry Geyer. Wrote letter to Mrs. Emma M. Spurling
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 30 above. hauled wood on wheels fro Mrs. Chas Pendleton. James Gerrish had wrote letter to Mr. Jerry Woosten of Hancock
The wind North East fresh breeze Thermometer 30 wrote letters to Chas Shaw & Eastern Express Agent at Milbridge Filled out the paper for the new P.O. at Birch Harbor.
The wind South west. and Thermometer. 4 degrees. Work apart of the day on Fred cranes dora. Wrote letter to APWiswell.
The wind South South East and moderate and foggy. Thermometer 39 degrees Work on day for Solomon Pendelton on dora. Wrote letter to L. A. Emery
The wind Southerly Thermometer 47 degrees Work all day for N.A. Bickford shingling house. Wrote letter to John Crabtree. of Hancock
The wind South East Thermometer 50 degrees went out to my troll fishing wrote letter to A. P. Wiswell
The wind South West. Thermometer 67 degrees Went out fishing. Wrote letter to G. H. Smith
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog Thermometer 68 work about house. wrote letter to C. Y. Bunker Commenced haying for my self.
The wind Northerly in forenoon went out fishing Wind Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 72 Wrote letter to Geo M Waren Castine.
The wind Southerly and thick with fog. did not go out to my troll Wrote letter to A.P. Eiswell Esq and John Bruinmer Thermometer 61 degrees

Wind Southerly and Thermometer 70 degrees Wrote letter to Wm Handy Owner of Schr Old Chad Geo. M. Warren and to the Post Office Department last named letter for David Weare. Went out fishing afternoon

Wind Southerly and thick with fog Wrote letter to J. H. Smallidge Boston. Thermometer. 49 degrees Went. Cherryfield to the Narraguagus Lodge Masonic With Reuben Hammond. late in the aftenoon wind North West rain squalls evening cleared of Came home in night.
The wind South East Thermometer 54 degrees Wrote letter to Henry Handy at night Commenced raining and blowing very heavy and at 10 PM. rain fell in torrents with a gale of wind.
The wind West North West Thermometer in morning 22 degrees above zero. Wrote letter to Stephen Southard the wind blowing a gale.
Wind West North West Thermometer 18 degrees above in morning. had wagon wheel tire set in forenoon and in the afternoon work for J. D. Harrington on barn Wrote letter to A P Wiswell
Wind North West Thanksgiving day Thermometer 12 above Wrote letter to Dr Porter worked a while in afternoon for J D Harrington.
Wind North West blowing heavy. Thermometer 12 above Wrote letter to W. F. Vose. Went to West Gouldsboro after J. F. Kingsleys horse cart.
The wind North West blowing fresh Thermometer 32 in shade at noon above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B. Viall hauled wood and cut it at the door.

The wind Southerly and moderate Thermometer in the morning being 20 degrees above zero Wrote letter home and to Chicago Lying at Commercial wharf Boston Went to the Seamens Bethel Hanover street in the evening
